intro: Galearis spectabilis, commonly known as the showy greenbulb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 feet and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink to red and are clustered in racemes, making it a visually appealing addition to gardens. Galearis spectabilis prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks.
